text:
Democrats have created over 13 million jobs since the start of President Biden’s term. 
 
We can’t let our progress be hampered by partisan infighting. I remain focused on helping working families – not extreme ideologies.

A Supreme Court decision earlier this year threw a wrench in @POTUS’s plan to cancel up to $20K in student debt. But we haven’t given up.
 
You may be eligible for other student debt relief programs. Find out if you qualify: studentaid.gov/loan-simulato…

Today, the House suffered an unprecedented and brutal display of partisan infighting.
 
But Democrats stand united.
 
We stand for common sense. We stand for reason. We stand for putting the American people first – always.
 
And we will continue to do so.

Nearly 3 in 10 Americans struggle to afford their medications. I voted for the Inflation Reduction Act to allow Medicare to directly negotiate drug prices and save 15 million Americans $800/year.
 
No one should go without lifesaving medication because of cost — period.
Congratulations to @WNBA Rookie of the Year @aa_boston! This unanimous decision is well-deserved – and it’s just the beginning.

Democrats saved us from a government shutdown. And we’ll keep doing what’s best for the American people.
 
That means fighting for new jobs, lower drug prices, and a stronger middle class – not pandering to extreme special interests.

Student loan payments restart today, and approximately 1 in 5 student borrowers will struggle with student debt repayments. That’s over 8 million borrowers.
 
Americans deserve student debt relief.

I voted yes today on an imperfect continuing resolution to protect my constituents from a government shutdown. 
 
While it’s not a permanent solution, it’s a step forward for the American people. I’ll keep working to put people over politics, and compromise over chaos.

With just 1 day until government funding runs out, MAGA extremists are still making radical demands, infighting, and pushing America towards a reckless shutdown that would hurt working families.
 
In the face of chaos, Democrats stand united and ready to find common ground.

The @IndianaLatino Leadership Circle empowers the next generation of Hoosier leaders. It was great to connect with this incredible group today to discuss education, the future of DACA, and how we can continue to uplift Latino voices!

A shutdown would cause 148,000 Hoosiers to lose access to WIC benefits almost immediately.
 
That means babies would go without formula. Toddlers would go without meals. Breastfeeding mothers wouldn’t have the nutrients they need.

This isn't a game. #StoptheShutdown
We need to expand federal food assistance programs, not cut them – and I’ll keep fighting to make sure no child goes to bed hungry.
In a new report, half of SNAP recipients reported eating less. 30% reported relying on family or friends for meals. And 40% acknowledged they have to skip meals because of lack of food.

Millions of families rely on programs like SNAP and WIC, but even current levels of funding aren’t enough to combat food insecurity. Pandemic-era benefits have ended, and families are struggling more than ever to put food on the table.

Incidents like the train derailment in Ohio earlier this year show how important it is to strengthen rail safety — before tragedy occurs. 
Glad to see @POTUS’s investment in rail safety in Indiana, & I’ll continue to champion this issue on @TransportDems. 
ibj.com/articles/indiana-amo…

Providing quality constituent services has always been my top priority. #TeamCarson hosts mobile office hours every third Thursday from 12-2pm at @HVAFofIndiana 964 N. Pennsylvania St. Stop by to learn how my office can help you!

Gun violence has affected nearly every family in our country, causing unnecessary pain & grief. It’s past time we do something about it.
 
Thank you @POTUS and @VP for taking action – not just thoughts and prayers – with the first White House Office of Gun Violence Prevention.
I wish everyone in Indianapolis and across the country observing Yom Kippur a blessed fast and meaningful period of reflection. G’mar Chatima Tovah.

It’s National Recovery Month, and as a member of the Fentanyl Caucus, I’m committed to bringing more funding to help individuals affected by substance use disorder. Recovery is possible – learn more about treatment options: cdc.gov/stopoverdose/stigma/

A government shutdown would affect:
 
🏥Healthcare for veterans
🥗Nutrition programs
🇺🇸National security

And much more. We can’t let MAGA extremists play games with American families. @SpeakerMcCarthy must act to prevent a shutdown.

I’m wearing red in support of my brothers and sisters @UAW. Auto workers keep our economy running and our country moving. With the auto industry making historic profits, workers deserve fair wages and benefits that reflect their hard work and sacrifices.

Disadvantaged neighborhoods have historically been left behind in infrastructure growth -- like how the interstate system uprooted Black communities. That's why I’m joining the @IndyNAACP in calling for equitable placement of EV chargers. We can't repeat past mistakes.

Thank you, @SecretaryPete, for acknowledging the dangers of blocked railroad crossings. In Indiana, kids have had to crawl under trains to get to school, and emergency vehicles have had to be rerouted because of blocked crossings – we must do more. @TransportDems

Happening today! It’s an honor to host @SecretaryPete at today’s @TransportDems hearing. Under President Biden’s leadership, we’ve made huge strides under the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw – with even more progress to come.

I joined 97 of my fellow @NewDemCoalition colleagues in a letter to @SpeakerMcCarthy urging him to put partisanship aside and find common ground to keep the government open and deliver for the American people.

Read more here: carson.house.gov/media/press…

The late Congressman John Lewis called the right to vote precious, almost sacred. Today, @HouseDemocrats are taking action to protect that fundamental right with the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

We can't allow extremists to undermine democracy & silence our voices.

Auto workers keep our economy running and our country moving. With the auto industry making historic profits, workers deserve fair wages and benefits that reflect their hard work and sacrifices.

I’m proud to stand with @Labor_Caucus in solidarity with @UAW.

The deadline to stop a government shutdown is fast approaching. Speaker McCarthy could end this TODAY. Instead, he is caving to political stunts from MAGA extremists that would hurt working families.
 
Enough is enough.

Hispanic Americans come from many different countries and backgrounds but are united by the same desires as every other American: to create a better life for themselves and their families. This Hispanic Heritage Month, we acknowledge their contributions, history, and heritage.
The message of Rosh Hashanah is universal. Let us remember to spread compassion, love, and care – now, and for the years to come. Shana Tovah U’Metukah!

.@carrier’s new training facility will help prepare the next generation of HVAC workers. This is an investment in the middle class and the values of our country: the chance to make it in America, no matter where you come from. Congratulations!

It’s the 15th anniversary of the 2008 financial crisis. In its aftermath, I voted to create the @CFPB to protect consumers – but next month, this essential agency may be threatened as a case goes before the Supreme Court.

We can’t go back. We need to #DefendCFPB.

Time is running out. Congress must fund the federal government by Sept. 30 or face a shutdown.
 
Instead of working to prevent a shutdown, House Republicans wasted today on a political stunt to restrict energy-efficient cars—an attack on the auto industry and our climate.

Yet another infrastructure announcement for Indiana!
 
This funding will improve recycling services, create jobs, and keep trash out of landfills – all while advancing environmental justice goals.  The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law continues to deliver. ♻️

It’s an honor to have Indy resident Essence represent our community at the National Youth Employment Coalition Conference! Everyone – no matter where you start in life – deserves the chance to succeed, and it’s advocates like Essence who are making that goal a reality.

20 years ago today, Indiana lost a legend. 

Governor Frank O’Bannon represented true decency and bipartisanship — values that inspire me and countless others to this day. Today, we make a promise to continue carrying out his mission to make life better for all Hoosiers.

This news is devastating, but unfortunately not surprising.
 
Last year, Republicans blocked our efforts to expand the #ChildTaxCredit, favoring tax cuts for the wealthy instead. Families deserve some relief — it’s past time my colleagues get on board.
pbs.org/newshour/show/child-….
We can’t let extremists run our government. The American people deserve progress, not political vendettas.
This new impeachment threat is a pathetic, hyper-partisan attempt to distract and deflect from criminal indictments against current and former elected officials – from George Santos to Donald Trump.

I voted to impeach Donald Trump twice based on overwhelming evidence he abused his office and put his personal and political goals over our national security, our democracy, and our country’s welfare. 🧵:

The impact of a 6.8-magnitude earthquake in Morocco is devastating, and rescue missions are increasingly challenging. My heart is with our Moroccan brothers and sisters — inshallah they find safety and healing in the days and weeks ahead.
Hoosiers! Join us TONIGHT for the next Academy Day in partnership with @SenatorBraun. Students can attend to learn more about the opportunities available through our military academies.

With over 26.4 million EVs expected on the road by 2030, we need more EV charging stations – & we need to make sure Black neighborhoods aren’t left behind. I’ll continue supporting ways to help everyone benefit from this rapidly growing industry. ibj.com/articles/alliance-ai…

Today is a solemn day.
 
We will never forget the fear and uncertainty on September 11, 2001, but also the immense courage. From first responders who rushed to the scene, to families who grieved together, America remains resilient. #911Anniversary

Indiana steel built this country—and now, thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, it’s more important than ever.

This law will build new bridges, roads, rail, and more. But it’s also an investment in jobs and the hardworking men and women of @smartunionworks

It’s #InternationalLiteracyDay, and @BldgTomorrow has been recognized by the Library of Congress Literacy Awards Program! With the goal of improving learning for children in rural Uganda, Building Tomorrow is an example of Indy leaders making an impact. buildingtomorrow.org/program…
Subscribe to my newsletter to find out where we’ll be next: carson.house.gov/contact/new…

Team Carson is here to serve! Each month, my office holds office hours at locations across Indianapolis. From immigration and passport issues, to social security and healthcare, to navigating student loans, we’re here to help YOU.

Once again, it’s clear abortion bans don’t prevent abortions from happening altogether. It just means those with the money and resources to travel can access this necessary healthcare, while low-income families are left behind. 
 
Hoosiers deserve better.
apple.news/AczrKMEiITGeIbimZ…

Air quality affects everyone's health and well-being. That's why @EPA has improved the @AIRNow app, which provides real time information about the air quality in your area. I encourage you to check it out, and I'll keep working to protect our environment.
airnow.gov/airnow-mobile-app…

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law represents the largest EVER federal investments in:
 
🚌Public transit
💧 Clean drinking water
⚡️ Clean energy and EV infrastructure
🚊Passenger rail since the creation of Amtrak

And we're just getting started.

Interested in attending one of America's elite service academies? Then don't miss next week's Academy Day, hosted by @SenatorBraun and I, where we will help answer your questions. Hoosier students, parents, guardians and educators are encouraged to attend. See you there!
Apply online here: va.gov/health-care/apply/app…

Did you know my office has helped secure over $5 million in benefits to local veterans?

If you were deployed to a combat zone, left active duty between 9/11/01 - 10/1/13 & never enrolled in VA healthcare, you're eligible to enroll directly. Apply online or in person by Sept 30

Thanks to pro-labor laws like the Inflation Reduction Act & Bipartisan Infrastructure Law creating good-paying union jobs, we’re moving in the right direction. But we can't let up. I'll remain your champion in Congress as we keep fighting together to reclaim the American dream.

This #LaborDay, I am especially grateful to the workers in Indiana and across America who are putting everything on the line for fair pay and better treatment. This holiday is a time to honor workers, but also a chance to reaffirm our commitment to them.

With 187,000 new jobs in August, the American job market continues to grow. 

Bidenomics is about strengthening and investing in the middle class – and it’s working.

$4 billion in federal investments means new roads, bridges, and rail for our state. It also means good-paying jobs – right here at home in Indiana.
 
Read more about @SecretaryPete’s visit to Indianapolis and America’s new era for infrastructure:  indianapublicmedia.org/news/…

“BUTTER” is more than just a fine arts fair. It’s a movement.
 
It was great to stop by opening night of this celebration of Black art, Black creators, and Black excellence. Thank you @ganggangculture for continuing to uplift and showcase Hoosier artists! #ButterArtFair

Everywhere you look, you can see federal investments in action.

From a new @USDOT @SecretaryPete grant to connect downtown neighborhoods, funding for the reconstruction of Market St, and improving @IndyGoBus, we’re transforming Indianapolis’ aging infrastructure.
Read more about Idle Park here: idleindy.com/

5 years ago, Tom Battista opened Idle Park to help reconnect four neighborhoods. Overlooking the interstate, this park is a unique way for neighbors to gather. I was proud to work with Tom to make his vision a reality, and it was great to visit today and see how far it's come!

There’s just certain jobs computers & AI can’t do. That’s why we’re reinvesting in the heart and soul of our nation: the American worker.

Indiana steel continues to build our future. Under President Biden, we’ll keep supporting our workforce with good policies & more resources.

Our first stop today was @smartunionworks Local 20’s apprenticeship facility. The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw is creating a record number of jobs, including 800,000 manufacturing jobs. This benefits American workers across construction and manufacturing industries.

It’s an honor to welcome @SecretaryPete to Indianapolis today! We’ll be making stops throughout the city to see how President Biden’s plan to grow the middle class is paying off. Be sure to follow along!

This is what a pro-worker administration looks like. Thanks, @POTUS, for sticking up for people's right to be paid fairly.
wishtv.com/news/national/mil…
Welcome to Indiana, @FLOTUS and @Surgeon_General ! We’re excited to show you what Hoosier Hospitality is all about. wishtv.com/news/first-lady-j…

Through laws like the Inflation Reduction Act, Democrats are fighting to lower the costs of prescription drugs. Nobody should have to choose between lifesaving medication and other household expenses. It's long past time we change this unjust system.

A truly strong economy must work for everyone, not just those at the top. Democrats understand this, and our economic plan is helping to increase opportunity from the bottom up and the middle out.

Read more about our progress so far:
whitehouse.gov/briefing-room…

Even though our economy is growing and inflation is down, many Americans still experience sticker shock for everyday items.

That's why I'm working with fellow Democrats to lower the cost of necessities like prescription drugs, electric bills and health plans.

On this day 68 years ago, 14-year-old Emmett Till was brutally murdered. And on this day, a new generation of civil rights advocates was galvanized and mobilized.

Today, we remember the pain & loss so we can continue the fight for racial justice. We remember Emmett Till. #Till68

The #MarchonWashington was 60 years ago, but the goals of this historic gathering are just as relevant today. Thanks to those who marched, we've made progress achieving justice for all, but we still have work to do. 

Let's continue to carry their legacy forward.

The numbers don’t lie. Heat waves have gotten worse in recent years – and with over 1/3 of Hoosier workers employed in heat-exposed industries, it’s a workers’ rights issue.
 
I’ll keep supporting ways to mitigate the negative impacts of extreme heat.

The grants keep coming!
 
I helped secure an additional $1 million from @EPA to strengthen our work to reduce exposure to air toxins, water contamination and pesticides across Indiana. This will make our communities healthier, and I’ll work to ensure Indy gets our fair share.

Attention Hoosiers with Federal student loans: @POTUS' new SAVE Plan has launched, and it may help you save money on your monthly payments. Read more about this plan to reduce the burden of #studentdebt for millions of Americans: whitehouse.gov/briefing-room…

This extreme law has made our state more unsafe and inhospitable for countless Hoosier families. That’s why we can’t be deterred; we must continue fighting to protect reproductive rights here at home and across America.  
wthr.com/amp/article/news/lo…

Last month, Indiana added nearly 14,000 jobs, and our unemployment rate remains low at 3.3%.  
 
Just think about where we were this time in 2020, when our unemployment rate was more than double what it is today. 
 
We’re making good progress, and we can’t turn back.

Hoosier high school students! You may be able to take part in the Congressional App Challenge, a way to support STEM and coding education. You have until November 1 to submit a project. Learn how you can participate here: carson.house.gov/7th-distric…

WEEKEND READ: Inflation is down & job creation is up. That's largely thanks to Democratic policies that are empowering working people who deserve a shot at success.

Reaganomics failed us, but #Bidenomics is working.
 
Read more in my new @indystar column:
indystar.com/story/opinion/2…

Funding alert! 

I helped secure $1 million to @IndyParksandRec for afterschool programming – an important tool to give our city’s children every opportunity to succeed.

Read more in my latest @IndyRecorder column about why embracing diversity is vital.
indianapolisrecorder.com/why…

For countless Americans, "the good old days" are a painful reminder of the discrimination we've endured. Yet many of my colleagues have waged war against diversity initiatives so they can take us back to this mythical time that never was. We need to move forward, not backward.

The #InflationReductionAct has resulted in:

🌳 $278 BILLION in clean energy to save our planet & create jobs.
💊 386,000 Hoosiers saving an average of $470/month on prescription drugs.
📈 36,700 new businesses in my district alone, giving everyone a chance to make it in America.

The #InflationReductionAct was signed 1 year ago, and it’s already delivering. 

That’s because we’re rebuilding the economy with the middle class in mind, not big corporations.

.@POTUS is right – we have work left to do, but we're making monumental progress.
 
It's been 1 year since the #InflationReductionAct was signed. We’ll keep lowering costs, investing in the middle class, and making life better for everyday Americans.

Moms often face bias, career interruptions, & lower pay after having a child – leading to moms making 62 cents for every dollar dads make. 

On #MomsEqualPayDay, we must acknowledge the unequal treatment of moms vs. dads and fight to give every parent the same opportunities.

Across the country, houses of worship have been targeted by swatting with the goal of disrupting services. We must safeguard the right of people of all faiths to pray and gather in peace. I join @ADL in condemning this hate. adl.org/resources/press-rele…

It's the 88th anniversary of #SocialSecurity, and I'm proud to support the Social Security 2100 Act to expand benefits for the first time in over 50 years. In my district, Social Security helps:
☑️ 80,388 retirees
☑️ 11,488 children
☑️ 6,639 widows
☑️ 22,823 disabled workers
Mark your calendars! I’ll be joining @SenatorBraun to host an Academy Day one month from today. Join us to learn more about how to apply to U.S. service academies.

Transit in Indianapolis just keeps getting better and better.
 
@IndyGoBus’s new East Campus will keep our city moving, combined with over $52 million from the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw. I’ll keep bringing monumental investments home as we enter a new era for transit.
Happy 50th birthday, Hip Hop! Sending a big thanks to DJ Kool Herc, Cindy Campbell and all of the pioneers today. I’ll keep uplifting this American art form in Congress. #hiphop50thanniversary

📢Veterans, if you were exposed to toxic substances during your service, you may be eligible for extra benefits under the PACT Act. The deadline to submit your intent to file has been extended to Monday! Go to ➡️VA.gov/pact

Just outside my district, books from Indianapolis author @johngreen have been moved from the teen section, along with a novel exploring the legacy of Malcom X and many others.
 
Book bans seek to silence. We must continue to make noise.

One year ago today, @POTUS signed the #CHIPSandScienceAct — and it's working.

✅Wages are rising faster than inflation
✅The price of food, cars, & gas are declining
✅13.2 million jobs have been created since @POTUS took office

In my district alone, it’s estimated that over 35,000 veterans could qualify for PACT Act benefits but have not yet applied. Apply by TODAY to receive money going back last year!

I’m proud to have voted for this monumental legislation. Apply here: va.gov/pact

With over 300 attendees, the 2023 Job & Resource Fair was a success! A big thanks to @IvyTech_Indy, @IndyDMD, and all the employers and organizations who showed up to bring new opportunities to Hoosiers.
Today’s the day! If you’re looking for a new job, a part time job, a better job or a brand new career, this event is the place to be in Indy.

My Job and Resource Fair is happening tomorrow, August 8 from 11am to 2pm at Ivy Tech Culinary and Conference Center. Be sure to stop by and connect with a wide array of employers looking to hire Hoosiers. Learn more: carson.house.gov/about/event…

3 years ago, under former President Trump, our unemployment rate was over 10%.
 
Today, under President Biden, it's fallen to 3.5%. We've also created 13.4 million jobs during his time in office.
 
Democrats pulled our economy back from the brink, & we're making it even stronger.

I want to send a warm welcome to everyone visiting Indianapolis for @Gen_Con this weekend. The world of gaming keeps getting better, and we're excited that the community surrounding it continues to gather and innovate in our city. Have fun!
Learn more about Heather’s work here: wrtv.com/lifestyle/multiplyi…

Congratulations to Heather Harvey, a member of my team, for receiving the @wrtv Jefferson Award for Multiplying Good for her long-time service to veterans through my office. Her commitment to these brave Hoosiers is clear to anyone lucky enough to know her. We're proud of you!

Another solid jobs report!
 
187,000 jobs were created in July, adding to a total of 13.4 million new jobs since @POTUS took office. 

Unemployment has also been under 4% for 18 months in a row -- the longest stretch in over 50 years.

#Bidenomics is working, folks.
I’m glad August didn’t slip away without this news! @taylorswift13, you’ll soon know all too well that Indy fans are the best in the world.

Today, I'm thinking about the 11 people killed at the Tree of Life Synagogue in 2018 and wishing peace and comfort to their loved ones. We will never forget them, or any other victim of violence, hatred, and antisemitism. May their memory be a blessing.

Each year, National Night Out is an opportunity for neighbors to make connections that last all year round. Thanks to the Arlington Woods and Crooked Creek Neighborhood Association for hosting me tonight! #NNO2023
This is an important moment for our country, and a critical step to safeguard our democracy and protect the vote.

My GOP colleagues just don't get it.  Hunger is not a moral failing -- it's a failure of the system. Cutting SNAP benefits and adding impossible hurdles for working families is not a solution; it's extremely harmful. #DefendSNAP

While I remain disappointed that #SCOTUS sided with the GOP's plan to strike down #studentloanforgiveness, I applaud @POTUS for continuing the fight to lessen this financial burden on hardworking Hoosiers. And I'll keep doing all I can to support this goal.

🚨Attention Hoosiers with student loans:

The Biden Administration has launched a new income driven repayment plan that may help you save money on your monthly payments when they resume. studentaid.gov/announcements…

Veterans, if you were exposed to toxic substances during your service, you may be eligible for benefits under the PACT Act. Apply by August 9 to ensure your new benefits are backdated to last year. Learn more: VA.gov/pact

Did you know that America’s transit agencies support more than 400,000 good-paying jobs?

This #BusMonth, I’m especially proud to have voted for the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to support @IndyGoBus and transit across the country.

It’s simple: there’s no safe level of lead in a child’s blood. The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw will replace all lead pipes in the next decade, starting with schools & childcare facilities. 

We're making clean drinking water a reality for all Americans. indianapolisrecorder.com/lea…

I applaud this move from @POTUS, which builds on my work in @HouseIntelDems to empower people experiencing sexual assault in the Intelligence Community to come forward. No public servant, or any person, should be afraid to seek justice.
cnn.com/2023/07/28/politics/…

It’s hot out there, Indianapolis – and the heat can be dangerous without proper safety measures. Stay hydrated, limit outside exposure, and check out the @IndyParks family centers available to keep cool: parks.indy.gov

#BlackWomensEqualPayDay marks the extra time into 2023 Black women must work to earn as much money as their white, male counterparts made in 2022 alone.
It's simple: people should be given equal pay for equal work, no matter their background. I'll keep working to achieve this.
It’s #NationalInternDay! Our interns are essential to #TeamCarson, and I'm proud to support efforts like @payourinterns so more students can have these valuable experiences.
The UAP debate shouldn’t be about gaining political points – it’s about protecting our national security. Glad to join @CNN this morning to discuss this issue!

Thank you, @POTUS, for honoring Emmett Till on what would be his 82nd birthday.

Learning & commemorating our history is not always easy, but it’s vital for our country’s future. This national monument will honor Emmett Till’s memory, his legacy, and the work we have left to do.

This landmark law is already bringing good paying, green jobs to Indiana and across America. 

That’s #Bidenonomics in action!
I joined my colleagues in reaffirming our commitment to advancing workers’ rights. Unions built our country, and we must ensure the right to collectively bargain is never threatened.

Attention veterans! The @DeptVetAffairs is launching an app to better connect you to your hard-earned benefits, payments, store discounts, and more—all on your smartphone. Learn more: mobile.va.gov/app/va-health-…
With this accomplishment, we honor Victor’s memory and  the memory of all who tragically perished on that fateful day.
This week, we finally passed an amendment mandating barriers in ALL aircrafts – thanks to the advocacy of leaders like Ellen Saracini, who tragically lost her pilot husband Victor on 9/11.

After 9/11, it became clear pilots needed extra protection from attacks. In 2018, my amendment passed requiring secondary cockpit barriers on new aircraft, but FAA still hasn’t implemented these requirements.

Today marks the 12th anniversary of @CFPB, and 12 years of looking out for Americans' finances and futures. I was honored to vote for the creation of this agency, which has put $17.5 billion dollars back in people's pockets, and I'll keep voting to make it stronger.

Today, I proudly voted in favor of the FAA Reauthorization bill, which will strengthen the aviation industry here in Indiana and across America. It'll also make flights safer, thanks to my amendment to require secondary cockpit barriers to protect pilots from attacks.
Welcome to Indianapolis, @VP! Honored to host you and my Delta sisters @dstinc1913 in the Circle City.

Republicans keep creating problems instead of offering real solutions. The House GOP just passed an unconscionable bill that punishes public schools for taking care of refugees. They call the bill "Schools not Shelters." How about compassion, and not cruelty? I proudly voted NO.

As the House debates the #FAAReauthorization bill, here’s a reminder that @INDairport is one of the best in the world!
 
I’ll keep fighting to strengthen and grow the aviation industry – a job creator, connector, and essential piece of our economy.

Over a year later, and still no insight or #JusticeForShireen. It is imperative that Congress have oversight on the killing of an American citizen and journalist killed abroad by a foreign government, especially one that receives $3.8B annually from American taxpayers.

Your vote is your voice, but many leaders are trying to silence it. From voter suppression to gerrymandering, this right is under threat every day in many ways. That’s why I’m an original cosponsor of the #FreedomToVoteAct to protect and strengthen the vote for all Americans.

It’s been a smoky summer in Indianapolis – and another reminder that climate change isn’t a problem for future generations. It’s here now.
 
I supported historic clean energy investments to help you save money and protect our climate. Sign up for updates: whitehouse.us1.list-manage.c…

I was honored to enter a statement into the Congressional Record recognizing the life of @MCSO_IN Deputy John Durm, who was laid to rest today. He was a true public servant, and his legacy will live on in his friends, his family, and the countless people he helped.

Unemployment is down, and job creation is up! Find new opportunities at my annual Job & Resource Fair with @IvyTechCC on August 8. 

I’ll keep fighting for more, better-paying jobs to help you and your family succeed.
 carson.house.gov/about/event…

SCOTUS ended consideration for college admissions based on race, but not for legacies and those with connections going back generations. How is that fair?
 
In my latest @IndyRecorder column, I'm sharing more of my views on this misguided decision: indianapolisrecorder.com/une…
It’s time to celebrate! #TeamCarson will be at the @INBlackExpoInc Summer Celebration all day. Stop by our booth to learn how we can assist you!

Student loan forgiveness is about giving hardworking, middle class and low-income families the relief they need.

Despite last week's setback in the Supreme Court, we won't stop fighting to lower student loan debt.

Protecting our nation and honoring our service members are extremely important to me, but I couldn't in good conscience vote for this package that undermines America's diversity, slows the fight against #climatechange and COVID-19, and much more.

House Republicans stripped common-sense provisions, like my two amendments to expand funding for #PancreaticCancer research at @DeptofDefense and protect American journalists abroad reporting from war zones, in exchange for far-right poison pills meant to score political points.
I voted NO on this year's #NDAA, which funds America's national defense budget, because the bill that came before the House looked nothing like the reasonable, bipartisan proposal it once was.

This is a good step forward by the @US_FDA to help women take better control of their own health amidst repeated attacks on their rights – but we can't rest until everyone has access to reproductive healthcare.

Inflation is down for the 12th consecutive month. And we have Democratic policies to thank. 
 
By focusing on growing the economy from the bottom up and middle out, we’re delivering real results for the American people. #Bidenomics

July is Transit #BusMonth, a chance to highlight the need to invest in our bus systems! I’m proud to have helped bring over $19 million to @IndyGoBus thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.
 
Transit is driving us towards a cleaner, greener future for all.

Our @MCSO_IN deputies play a critical role in protecting the citizens of Marion County. I’m deeply saddened to hear of this tragic incident, and I pray for Deputy John Durm, his family, and the entire Sheriff’s office during this difficult time.

Learn more about this grant here:
fox59.com/indiana-news/mayor…

This statistic is staggering: Black pedestrians are more than 2x as likely to be struck and killed by a vehicle.

Whether it’s a bad flu season or the outbreak of a new infectious disease, my bill will ensure Indianapolis and cities across the country are better coordinated to respond to the world’s most serious health problems.
The Bipartisan Diagnostic Testing Preparedness Plan Act will streamline those processes and require @HHSGov to develop a plan to be used during public health emergencies.

But the pandemic also revealed gaps in tests available in the US – like supply chain issues & reliance on foreign countries for materials, poor coordination between the gov’t & diagnostics companies, & the need to improve capacity to develop accurate, externally validated tests.

Diagnostics can address a range of health issues, from infectious diseases and diabetes management to cancer and cardiac health. During the pandemic, it became more important than ever to use diagnostics to respond to the COVID-19 emergency as fast and effectively as possible.

Today, I introduced the Bipartisan Diagnostic Testing Preparedness Plan Act with @RepGregPence, @RepLarryBucshon, and @RepKimSchrier. This bill will develop a diagnostics plan for public health emergencies.

I’ve been working to implement long-overdue safety recommendations from the @NTSB since my constituents died in the tragic Duck Boat accident in Branson, Missouri in 2018. The Coleman family from Indianapolis might still be alive today if our provisions had been in place.
